name: Acne
text: Acne is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms: Blackheads, Whiteheads, Pimples, Cysts, Nodules. Treatments: Topical creams and gels containing benzoyl peroxide or retinoids, Oral medications such as antibiotics or isotretinoin, Chemical peels, Laser and light therapies.

name: Appendicitis
text: Appendicitis is a condition where the appendix becomes inflamed and swollen, usually as a result of an infection. Symptoms: Pain in the lower right side of the abdomen, Nausea and vomiting, Loss of appetite, Fever, Constipation or diarrhea. Treatments: Surgery to remove the appendix, Antibiotics to treat the infection, Pain medication.

name: Arthritis
text: Arthritis is a condition where one or more joints become inflamed, causing pain, stiffness, and limited range of motion. Symptoms: Joint pain and stiffness, Swelling and redness around the joint, Limited range of motion, Fatigue, Fever. Treatments: Pain medication, Anti-inflammatory drugs, Physical therapy, Joint replacement surgery.

name: Asthma
text: Asthma is a chronic condition where the airways in the lungs become inflamed and narrow, making it difficult to breathe. Symptoms: Wheezing, Coughing, Shortness of breath, Chest tightness, Difficulty breathing. Treatments: Bronchodilators to open up the airways, Corticosteroids to reduce inflammation, Leukotriene modifiers, Immunomodulators.

name: Atherosclerosis
text: Atherosclerosis is a condition where plaque builds up inside the arteries, making them narrower and restricting blood flow. Symptoms: Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Weakness or numbness in limbs, Headache, Blurry vision. Treatments: Lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking and eating a healthy diet, Medications to lower cholesterol and blood pressure, Angioplasty or stenting to open up blocked arteries, Surgery to bypass blocked arteries.

name: Bronchitis
text: Bronchitis is an inflammation of the lining of the bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from the lungs. Symptoms: Persistent cough, Mucus production, Wheezing, Shortness of breath, Chest discomfort. Treatments: Rest and hydration, Over-the-counter cough medicine, Inhaled bronchodilators, Corticosteroids, Antibiotics (if bacterial).

name: Cataracts
text: Cataracts are a clouding of the eye's natural lens, which can cause blurry vision and eventually blindness if left untreated. Symptoms: Blurred or dimmed vision, Difficulty seeing at night, Sensitivity to light, Frequent changes in eyeglass or contact lens prescription. Treatments: Prescription eyeglasses or contact lenses, Surgery to remove and replace the clouded lens.

name: Celiac disease
text: Celiac disease is an autoimmune disorder in which the body's immune system attacks the small intestine when gluten is ingested, leading to damage and malabsorption of nutrients. Symptoms: Abdominal pain and bloating, Diarrhea or constipation, Fatigue, Weight loss, Iron-deficiency anemia. Treatments: A gluten-free diet, Supplements to correct nutrient deficiencies.

name: Cirrhosis
text: Cirrhosis is a late stage of liver disease in which healthy liver tissue is replaced with scar tissue, impairing liver function and leading to a range of symptoms. Symptoms: Fatigue and weakness, Loss of appetite and weight loss, Nausea and vomiting, Abdominal swelling and pain, Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes). Treatments: Treatment of underlying causes (e.g., alcohol cessation, hepatitis treatment), Medications to manage symptoms, Liver transplant in severe cases.

name: Colitis
text: Colitis is an inflammation of the colon, which can cause a range of symptoms depending on the underlying cause. Symptoms: Abdominal pain and cramping, Diarrhea or constipation, Rectal bleeding, Urgent bowel movements, Fever and fatigue. Treatments: Anti-inflammatory medications, Immunosuppressants, Surgery to remove the colon in severe cases.

name: Conjunctivitis
text: Conjunctivitis, also known as pink eye, is an inflammation of the conjunctiva, which is the thin, clear tissue that lines the inside of the eyelid and covers the white part of the eye. Symptoms: Redness in the white of the eye or inner eyelid, Increased amount of tears, Thick yellow discharge that crusts over the eyelashes, especially after sleep, Itchy or burning eyes, Blurred vision, Sensitivity to light. Treatments: Artificial tears, Antihistamine eye drops, Topical corticosteroids, Cold compresses, Warm compresses.

name: Crohn's disease
text: Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus. Symptoms include abdominal pain, diarrhea, and weight loss. Symptoms: Abdominal pain and cramping, Diarrhea, Blood in your stool, Reduced appetite and weight loss, Fatigue, Fever. Treatments: Anti-inflammatory drugs, Immune system suppressors, Antibiotics, Nutrition therapy, Surgery.

name: Cystic fibrosis
text: Cystic fibrosis is an inherited disorder that causes severe damage to the lungs, digestive system and other organs in the body. It affects the cells that produce mucus, sweat and digestive juices. Symptoms: Persistent cough with thick mucus, Wheezing or shortness of breath, Poor growth or weight gain, Frequent respiratory infections, Salty-tasting skin, Difficulty with bowel movements. Treatments: Airway clearance techniques, Inhaled medications, Oral pancreatic enzyme supplements, Antibiotics, Nutrition therapy.

name: Dementia
text: Dementia is a general term for a decline in mental ability severe enough to interfere with daily life. Memory loss is an example. Alzheimer's is the most common type of dementia. Symptoms: Memory loss, Difficulty communicating, Inability to focus or pay attention, Poor reasoning or judgment, Confusion and disorientation, Mood changes. Treatments: Medications to treat cognitive symptoms, Antidepressants, Antipsychotics, Occupational therapy, Speech therapy.

name: Diabetes mellitus
text: Diabetes mellitus is a chronic metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels due to the body's inability to produce or use insulin effectively. Symptoms: Increased thirst, Frequent urination, Extreme hunger, Unexplained weight loss, Fatigue, Blurred vision, Slow-healing sores or frequent infections, Tingling or numbness in the hands or feet, Dry, itchy skin. Treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g. diet, exercise), Oral medications (e.g. metformin, sulfonylureas), Insulin therapy, Blood sugar monitoring, Regular check-ups with a healthcare provider.

name: Emphysema
text: Emphysema is a lung disease that damages the air sacs in the lungs. This damage makes it harder to breathe and can lead to shortness of breath, coughing, and wheezing. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially during physical activities, Wheezing, Chest tightness, Chronic cough, Lack of energy. Treatments: Quitting smoking, Medications such as bronchodilators, inhaled steroids, or oxygen therapy, Pulmonary rehabilitation, Lung volume reduction surgery, Lung transplant.

name: Endometriosis
text: Endometriosis is a condition where the tissue that normally lines the inside of the uterus grows outside of it, leading to pain and discomfort. Symptoms: Painful periods, Pain during intercourse, Painful bowel movements or urination during menstruation, Excessive bleeding, Infertility. Treatments: Pain relievers such as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Hormone therapy, Surgery to remove endometrial tissue, Assisted reproductive technologies (ART).

name: Epilepsy
text: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder that causes seizures, which can range from mild to severe and affect different parts of the brain. Symptoms: Seizures, Temporary confusion, Staring spells, Loss of consciousness, Psychic symptoms. Treatments: Antiepileptic drugs (AEDs), Surgery to remove the part of the brain causing seizures, Vagus nerve stimulation (VNS), Ketogenic diet.

name: Fibromyalgia
text: Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition that causes widespread pain and tenderness in the body, as well as fatigue, sleep disturbances, and cognitive difficulties. Symptoms: Widespread pain, Tender points, Fatigue, Sleep disturbances, Cognitive difficulties. Treatments: Pain relievers such as acetaminophen, NSAIDs, or opioids, Antidepressants, Anticonvulsants, Physical therapy, Counseling.

name: Gallstones
text: Gallstones are hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in the gallbladder, causing pain and other complications. Symptoms: Sudden and rapidly intensifying pain in the upper right portion of your abdomen, Pain in the back between the shoulder blades, Pain in the right shoulder, Nausea, Vomiting. Treatments: Surgery to remove the gallbladder (cholecystectomy), Medications to dissolve gallstones, Lithotripsy.

name: Gastritis
text: Inflammation of the stomach lining Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Nausea, Vomiting. Treatments: Antacids, Proton pump inhibitors, Dietary changes.

name: Glaucoma
text: Damage to the optic nerve that can lead to vision loss Symptoms: Blurred vision, Eye pain, Headaches. Treatments: Eye drops, Laser surgery, Trabeculectomy.

name: Gout
text: A type of arthritis caused by a buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints Symptoms: Intense joint pain, Swelling, Redness. Treatments: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Colchicine, Urate-lowering therapy.

name: Hemorrhoids
text: Swollen veins in the anus and lower rectum Symptoms: Bleeding, Pain or discomfort, Itching. Treatments: Over-the-counter creams or ointments, Sitz baths, Surgery.

name: Hernia
text: A bulge or protrusion of an organ or tissue through an abnormal opening in the abdominal wall Symptoms: A visible bulge, Pain or discomfort, Nausea or vomiting. Treatments: Watchful waiting, Hernia truss, Surgery.

name: Hiatal hernia
text: Hiatal hernia is a condition in which a portion of the stomach protrudes upward into the chest, through an opening in the diaphragm. Symptoms: Heartburn, Acid reflux, Difficulty swallowing, Chest or abdominal pain, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Antacids, Medications to reduce acid production, Surgery (in severe cases).

name: Inflammatory bowel disease
text: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is a group of chronic conditions that cause inflammation in the digestive tract. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Rectal bleeding, Fatigue, Weight loss. Treatments: Medications to reduce inflammation, Immunosuppressants, Surgery (in severe cases).

name: Interstitial cystitis
text: Interstitial cystitis (IC) is a chronic condition that causes bladder pain and discomfort. Symptoms: Pelvic pain, Frequent urination, Urgency to urinate, Painful urination, Pain during sexual intercourse. Treatments: Bladder distention (stretching), Medications to relieve bladder pain, Physical therapy, Nerve stimulation.

name: Irritable bowel syndrome
text: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a common condition that affects the large intestine. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Bloating, Diarrhea, Constipation, Mucus in the stool. Treatments: Dietary changes, Fiber supplements, Medications to control bowel movements.

name: Kidney stones
text: Kidney stones are hard deposits of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys. Symptoms: Severe pain in the side and back, below the ribs, Pain that radiates to the lower abdomen and groin, Painful urination, Pink, red or brown urine, Nausea and vomiting. Treatments: Drinking water to help pass the stone, Medications to relieve pain, Surgery (in severe cases).

name: Leukemia
text: Leukemia is a type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow, the spongy tissue inside bones where blood cells are made. Symptoms: Fatigue, Fever, Night sweats, Easy bruising or bleeding, Bone pain, Enlarged lymph nodes, Shortness of breath, Pale skin, Frequent infections, Weight loss, Headaches, Dizziness, Confusion, Seizures. Treatments: Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Stem cell transplant, Targeted therapy, Biological therapy.

name: Lymphoma
text: Lymphoma is a type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which is part of the body's immune system. Symptoms: Enlarged lymph nodes, Fever, Night sweats, Weight loss, Fatigue, Itching, Shortness of breath, Chest pain, Abdominal pain or swelling, Nausea, Vomiting, Loss of appetite, Headaches, Confusion, Seizures. Treatments: Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Stem cell transplant, Targeted therapy, Biological therapy.

name: Macular degeneration
text: Macular degeneration is an eye disease that causes loss of vision in the center of the field of vision. Symptoms: Blurred vision, Dark or empty areas in your central vision, Difficulty reading or recognizing faces, Distorted vision, Straight lines appearing wavy, Reduced central vision, Need for brighter light when reading or doing close work, Increased difficulty adapting to low light levels, Decreased intensity or brightness of colors. Treatments: Anti-VEGF therapy, Photodynamic therapy, Laser therapy, Vitamin supplements, Low vision aids.

name: Menopause
text: Menopause is a natural biological process that marks the end of a woman's menstrual cycles. Symptoms: Irregular periods, Hot flashes, Night sweats, Sleep problems, Mood changes, Weight gain and slowed metabolism, Thinning hair and dry skin, Loss of breast fullness, Vaginal dryness, Decreased sex drive, Pain during sex, Urinary incontinence, Increased urination or urgency. Treatments: Hormone therapy, Low-dose antidepressants, Gabapentin, Clonidine, Vaginal estrogen, Vaginal moisturizers and lubricants.

name: Migraine headaches
text: Migraine headaches are a type of headache that typically cause intense throbbing pain in one area of the head, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound. They can last for hours or days and can be disabling. Symptoms: Throbbing or pulsing pain on one side of the head, Sensitivity to light and sound, Nausea and vomiting, Blurred vision, Lightheadedness, Fatigue, Irritability. Treatments: Pain-relieving medications such as aspirin or ibuprofen, Triptans, which are medications specifically designed to treat migraines, Preventive medications such as beta blockers or antidepressants, Avoiding triggers such as certain foods, stress, and lack of sleep, Resting in a quiet, dark room.

name: Multiple sclerosis
text: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a chronic autoimmune disease of the central nervous system that affects the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerves. Symptoms: Fatigue, Numbness or tingling in the limbs, Muscle weakness or spasms, Blurred or double vision, Difficulty with coordination and balance, Problems with speech and swallowing. Treatments: Medications to slow the progression of the disease, Physical therapy, Occupational therapy, Speech therapy, Counseling or support groups.

name: Myocardial infarction
text: Myocardial infarction (MI), also known as a heart attack, occurs when blood flow to the heart muscle is blocked, usually by a blood clot. This can cause damage to the heart muscle and potentially be life-threatening. Symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort, Shortness of breath, Nausea or vomiting, Feeling lightheaded or dizzy, Sweating, Pain or discomfort in the arms, back, neck, jaw, or stomach. Treatments: Oxygen therapy, Aspirin or other antiplatelet medications, Thrombolytic therapy or percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) to restore blood flow, Beta blockers, ACE inhibitors, or other medications to prevent future heart attacks, Lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking, eating a healthy diet, and getting regular exercise.

name: Osteoarthritis
text: Osteoarthritis (OA) is a degenerative joint disease that occurs when the protective cartilage on the ends of bones wears down over time, causing pain, stiffness, and loss of mobility. Symptoms: Pain or stiffness in the joints, especially after periods of inactivity or overuse, Swelling or tenderness in the affected joints, A crunching or popping sensation when moving the joint, Limited range of motion, Bone spurs. Treatments: Over-the-counter pain relievers such as acetaminophen or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Prescription medications such as COX-2 inhibitors or corticosteroids, Physical therapy or occupational therapy, Assistive devices such as braces or canes, Lifestyle changes such as losing weight, getting regular exercise, and avoiding activities that exacerbate symptoms.

name: Osteoporosis
text: Osteoporosis is a bone disease that occurs when the body loses too much bone, makes too little bone, or both. As a result, bones become weak and may break from a fall or, in serious cases, from sneezing or minor bumps. Symptoms: Back pain, Loss of height over time, A stooped posture, A bone that breaks much more easily than expected. Treatments: Calcium and vitamin D supplements, Medications such as bisphosphonates, hormone therapy, and denosumab, Regular weight-bearing and muscle-strengthening exercise, Fall prevention measures, such as removing hazards and improving lighting in the home.

name: Parkinson's disease
text: Parkinson's disease is a neurodegenerative disorder that affects movement. It occurs when the brain cells that produce dopamine, a chemical that coordinates movement, die or become impaired. As a result, people with Parkinson's disease may experience tremors, stiffness, slow movement, and difficulty with balance and coordination. Symptoms: Tremors or shaking, usually in the hands, arms, or legs, Stiffness or rigidity of the limbs and trunk, Slow movement (bradykinesia), Impaired balance and coordination. Treatments: Medications that increase dopamine in the brain, such as levodopa, dopamine agonists, and MAO-B inhibitors, Deep brain stimulation (DBS), a surgical procedure that involves implanting electrodes in the brain, Physical therapy to improve movement and balance, Speech therapy to improve voice and communication, Occupational therapy to improve daily activities.

name: Peptic ulcer disease
text: Peptic ulcer disease is a condition in which painful sores or ulcers develop in the lining of the stomach, small intestine, or esophagus. Symptoms: Abdominal pain or discomfort, Nausea, Vomiting, Loss of appetite, Bloating, Belching, Weight loss. Treatments: Antibiotics to kill H. pylori bacteria, Proton pump inhibitors to reduce stomach acid, Antacids to neutralize stomach acid, H2 blockers to reduce acid production, Lifestyle changes (e.g., avoiding alcohol and spicy foods).

name: Pneumonia
text: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, causing coughing, fever, and difficulty breathing. Symptoms: Cough (with phlegm or without), Fever, Chills, Shortness of breath, Rapid breathing, Chest pain, Fatigue, Muscle aches, Nausea or vomiting. Treatments: Antibiotics to fight the underlying infection, Fever reducers (e.g., acetaminophen) to relieve symptoms, Cough medicine to reduce coughing, Oxygen therapy to help with breathing, Fluids and rest.

name: Polycystic kidney disease
text: Polycystic kidney disease is an inherited disorder in which clusters of cysts develop within the kidneys, eventually causing kidney failure. Symptoms: Pain in the back or side, Blood in urine, Frequent urination, Kidney stones, High blood pressure, Abdominal swelling, Fatigue, Joint pain. Treatments: Blood pressure medications to control high blood pressure, Antibiotics to treat infections, Surgery to remove large cysts or to transplant a new kidney, Dialysis to remove waste from the blood if kidneys fail.

name: Polycystic ovary syndrome
text: Polycystic ovary syndrome is a hormonal disorder that causes enlarged ovaries with small cysts on the outer edges, leading to infertility and other health problems. Symptoms: Irregular periods, Heavy bleeding, Acne, Excess hair growth, Weight gain, Fatigue, Depression or mood swings. Treatments: Birth control pills to regulate periods and decrease androgen levels, Anti-androgen medications to reduce excess hair growth and acne, Metformin to improve insulin resistance and regulate menstrual cycles, Fertility treatments (e.g., in vitro fertilization) for those trying to conceive.

name: Prostate Cancer
text: Prostate cancer is a type of cancer that develops in the prostate, a gland in the male reproductive system. It usually grows slowly and initially remains confined to the prostate gland, where it may not cause serious harm. However, in some cases, it can spread to other parts of the body and become more aggressive. Symptoms: Frequent urination, especially at night, Difficulty starting or stopping urination, Weak or interrupted urine flow, Blood in urine or semen, Painful or burning urination, Painful ejaculation, Difficulty getting or maintaining an erection. Treatments: Watchful waiting, Surgery, Radiation therapy, Cryotherapy, Hormone therapy, Chemotherapy.

name: Psoriasis
text: Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition that causes cells to build up rapidly on the surface of the skin. The extra skin cells form scales and red patches that are sometimes itchy and painful. Symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with thick, silvery scales, Dry, cracked skin that may bleed, Itching or burning sensations. Treatments: Topical creams and ointments, Light therapy, Oral medications.

name: Pulmonary embolism
text: Pulmonary embolism is a blockage in one of the pulmonary arteries in the lungs. The blockage is usually caused by a blood clot that travels to the lungs from another part of the body, most commonly the legs. Symptoms: Sudden shortness of breath, Chest pain that gets worse with deep breathing or coughing, Coughing up blood. Treatments: Blood thinners, Clot-dissolving medications, Surgery.

name: Rheumatoid arthritis
text: Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disorder that causes the body's immune system to attack the joints. This leads to inflammation and damage to the joints, which can cause pain, stiffness, and swelling. Symptoms: Joint pain and stiffness, Swelling and tenderness in the joints, Fatigue. Treatments: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs), Biologic agents.

name: Rosacea
text: Rosacea is a chronic skin condition that causes redness, flushing, and sometimes small, red, pus-filled bumps on the face. It most commonly affects the nose, cheeks, forehead, and chin. Symptoms: Redness on the cheeks, nose, chin or forehead, Small visible blood vessels on the face, Bumps or pimples on the face. Treatments: Topical creams and gels, Oral antibiotics, Laser therapy.

name: Sarcoidosis
text: Sarcoidosis is a disease that causes inflammation in different parts of the body, most commonly the lungs, lymph nodes, skin, and eyes. The inflammation can cause damage to these organs and may cause symptoms such as coughing, shortness of breath, and skin rashes. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Coughing, Skin rashes or lesions. Treatments: Corticosteroids, Immunosuppressive medications, Biologic agents.

name: Scoliosis
text: Scoliosis is a medical condition where the spine curves sideways. This can cause uneven shoulders, hips, or waist and can sometimes lead to discomfort or difficulty breathing. Symptoms: Uneven shoulders, Uneven hips, Uneven waist, Back pain, Difficulty breathing. Treatments: Bracing, Physical therapy, Surgery.

name: Sinusitis
text: Sinusitis is an inflammation or swelling of the tissue lining the sinuses, which can cause symptoms such as facial pain, pressure, or congestion. Symptoms: Facial pain, Pressure in the face, Congestion, Nasal discharge, Cough, Headache. Treatments: Nasal decongestants, Saline nasal irrigation, Antibiotics, Steroid nasal sprays.

name: Spondylitis
text: Spondylitis is a type of arthritis that affects the spine and can cause stiffness, pain, and reduced mobility. Symptoms: Stiffness in the back or neck, Pain in the back or neck, Reduced mobility, Fatigue, Loss of appetite. Treatments: Exercise, Medications, Surgery.

name: Stroke
text: A stroke occurs when blood flow to the brain is interrupted or reduced, which can cause brain cells to die. This can result in various symptoms, depending on which part of the brain is affected. Symptoms: Sudden numbness or weakness in the face, arm, or leg, especially on one side of the body, Sudden confusion or trouble speaking or understanding speech, Sudden trouble seeing in one or both eyes, Sudden trouble walking, dizziness, loss of balance or coordination, Sudden severe headache with no known cause. Treatments: Clot-busting drugs, Aspirin or other antiplatelet drugs, Anticoagulants, Surgery.

name: Systemic lupus erythematosus
text: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is an autoimmune disease that can affect various parts of the body, including the skin, joints, kidneys, brain, and other organs. Symptoms: Fatigue, Fever, Joint pain, Skin rashes, Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Headaches, Confusion, Memory loss. Treatments: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), Antimalarial drugs, Corticosteroids, Immunosuppressants, Biologics.

name: Tendinitis
text: Tendinitis is a condition in which the tendons — the thick cords that attach muscles to bone — become inflamed or irritated. Symptoms: Pain, Tenderness, Stiffness, Swelling, Weakness. Treatments: Rest, Ice, Compression, Elevation, Physical therapy, Medications, Surgery.

name: Thyroid disease
text: Thyroid disease is a common problem that can cause symptoms due to over- or under-function of the thyroid gland. Symptoms: Fatigue, Weight changes, Muscle weakness, Hair loss, Depression, Difficulty sleeping, Rapid heartbeat. Treatments: Thyroid hormone replacement therapy, Anti-thyroid medications, Radioactive iodine, Surgery.

name: Ulcerative colitis
text: Ulcerative colitis is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that causes inflammation and sores (ulcers) in the lining of the large intestine. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Rectal bleeding, Urgency to defecate, Weight loss, Fatigue. Treatments: Anti-inflammatory medications, Immunosuppressive medications, Biologic therapy, Surgery.

name: Varicose veins
text: Varicose veins are enlarged, twisted veins that are visible just under the surface of the skin. They usually occur in the legs, but can also form in other parts of the body. Symptoms: Swelling, Aching pain, Heaviness, Burning or itching, Discoloration, Ulcers. Treatments: Compression stockings, Sclerotherapy, Laser treatment, Endovenous ablation therapy, Surgery.

name: Alzheimer's disease
text: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive brain disorder that affects memory, thinking, and behavior. It is the most common cause of dementia in older adults. Symptoms: Memory loss, Difficulty completing familiar tasks, Language problems, Disorientation, Mood swings, Personality changes, Loss of motivation. Treatments: Medications, Non-drug treatments (e.g., cognitive stimulation therapy), Supportive therapies, Clinical trials.

name: Angina pectoris
text: Angina pectoris is a condition that causes chest pain or discomfort. It occurs when the heart muscle doesn't get enough blood and oxygen due to narrowed or blocked coronary arteries. Symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort, Pain or discomfort in the arms, neck, jaw, shoulder or back, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking, eating a healthy diet and exercising regularly, Medications to relieve pain and improve blood flow to the heart, Medical procedures such as angioplasty or bypass surgery.

name: Aortic stenosis
text: Aortic stenosis is a condition that occurs when the aortic valve narrows, restricting blood flow from the heart to the rest of the body. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Chest pain or discomfort, Fainting or lightheadedness. Treatments: Medications to manage symptoms, Balloon valvuloplasty to open the narrowed valve, Surgical valve replacement.

name: Aortic valve regurgitation
text: Aortic valve regurgitation is a condition that occurs when the aortic valve doesn't close properly, causing blood to leak back into the heart. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Swollen ankles or feet. Treatments: Medications to manage symptoms, Surgical valve repair or replacement.

name: Benign prostatic hyperplasia
text: Benign prostatic hyperplasia is a condition that causes the prostate gland to enlarge, leading to urinary problems. Symptoms: Frequent urination, Difficulty starting or stopping urination, Weak urine stream. Treatments: Medications to relax the muscles of the prostate gland and improve urine flow, Minimally invasive procedures such as transurethral microwave therapy or laser therapy, Surgery to remove the prostate gland.

name: Breast cancer
text: Breast cancer is a type of cancer that forms in the cells of the breast. Symptoms: A lump or thickening in the breast or underarm, Changes in the size or shape of the breast, Nipple discharge or retraction. Treatments: Surgery to remove the cancerous tissue, Radiation therapy to destroy cancer cells, Chemotherapy or targeted therapy to kill cancer cells.

name: Cardiomyopathy
text: Cardiomyopathy is a disease that affects the heart muscle, making it harder for the heart to pump blood to the rest of the body. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Swelling of the legs, ankles, or feet, Fatigue, Irregular heartbeat. Treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g., diet, exercise), Medications (e.g., ACE inhibitors, beta blockers), Implanted devices (e.g., pacemakers, defibrillators), Surgery (e.g., heart transplant).

name: Carotid Artery Disease
text: Carotid artery disease occurs when the carotid arteries, which supply blood to the brain, become narrowed or blocked by plaque buildup. Symptoms: Transient ischemic attacks (mini-strokes), Weakness or numbness on one side of the body, Trouble speaking or understanding speech, Dizziness. Treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g., diet, exercise), Medications (e.g., blood thinners, cholesterol-lowering drugs), Endarterectomy (surgical removal of plaque from artery), Angioplasty and stenting (using a balloon to widen the artery and placing a stent to hold it open).

name: Cerebral Aneurysm
text: A cerebral aneurysm is a weakened, bulging area in the wall of an artery in the brain that can rupture and cause bleeding in the brain. Symptoms: Severe headache, Nausea and vomiting, Stiff neck, Blurred or double vision. Treatments: Observation and monitoring (for small, unruptured aneurysms), Endovascular coiling (placing coils in the aneurysm to block blood flow), Clipping (placing a clip on the base of the aneurysm to prevent it from rupturing), Surgical removal of the aneurysm.

name: Cervical Cancer
text: Cervical cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the cervix, which is the lower part of the uterus that connects to the vagina. Symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding, Pain during sex, Pelvic pain, Unusual vaginal discharge. Treatments: Surgery (e.g., hysterectomy, removal of lymph nodes), Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy.

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
text: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a chronic lung disease characterized by obstruction of airflow from the lungs, making it difficult to breathe. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially during physical activities, Wheezing, Chest tightness, Chronic cough, Frequent respiratory infections, Lack of energy, Unintended weight loss. Treatments: Smoking cessation, Bronchodilators to relax the muscles around the airways, Inhaled corticosteroids to reduce inflammation, Pulmonary rehabilitation to improve lung function and overall fitness, Supplemental oxygen therapy, Surgery in severe cases.

name: Coronary artery disease
text: Coronary artery disease is a condition in which the arteries that supply blood to the heart become narrowed or blocked due to plaque buildup. Symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort, Shortness of breath, Heart palpitations, Nausea, Sweating. Treatments: Lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet and exercise, Medications such as aspirin and statins, Procedures such as angioplasty or bypass surgery.

name: Deep vein thrombosis
text: Deep vein thrombosis is a blood clot that forms in a vein deep inside the body, usually in the leg. Symptoms: Swelling in the affected leg, Pain or tenderness in the affected leg, Warmth in the skin over the affected leg, Red or discolored skin over the affected leg, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Anticoagulant medications to prevent the clot from getting bigger, Thrombolytic therapy to dissolve the clot, Compression stockings or devices to help prevent swelling and blood clots.

name: Diverticulitis
text: Diverticulitis is a condition in which small pouches that form in the wall of the colon become infected or inflamed. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, usually on the left side, Fever, Nausea, Vomiting, Constipation or diarrhea. Treatments: Antibiotics to treat the infection, Liquid diet or low-fiber diet to help the colon rest, Surgery to remove the affected part of the colon in severe cases.

name: Endocarditis
text: Endocarditis is an infection of the lining of the heart or heart valves. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Shortness of breath, Swelling in the legs, feet, or abdomen, Heart murmur. Treatments: Antibiotics to treat the infection, Surgery to repair or replace damaged heart valves, Anticoagulant medications to prevent blood clots.

name: Esophageal cancer
text: Esophageal cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the cells that line the esophagus. Symptoms: Difficulty swallowing, Unintentional weight loss, Chest pain or discomfort, Heartburn or indigestion, Chronic cough. Treatments: Surgery to remove the cancer, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy, Palliative care to manage symptoms in advanced cases.

name: Gallbladder cancer
text: Gallbladder cancer is a cancerous growth in the gallbladder, a small organ located beneath the liver that stores bile. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Jaundice, Nausea and vomiting, Loss of appetite, Weight loss. Treatments: Surgery to remove the gallbladder, Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy.

name: Gastroesophageal reflux disease
text: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) is a chronic condition in which acid reflux occurs more than twice a week, causing inflammation and irritation of the esophagus. Symptoms: Heartburn, Regurgitation, Difficulty swallowing, Chest pain. Treatments: Antacids, Proton pump inhibitors, H2 blockers, Lifestyle changes (e.g., weight loss, avoiding trigger foods).

name: Glomerulonephritis
text: Glomerulonephritis is a type of kidney disease in which the tiny filters in the kidneys become inflamed and damaged, leading to kidney failure. Symptoms: Blood in the urine, Foamy urine, Swelling in the face, hands, or feet, High blood pressure. Treatments: Medications to control blood pressure and reduce inflammation, Dialysis, Kidney transplant.

name: Heart failure
text: Heart failure is a chronic condition in which the heart is unable to pump enough blood to meet the body's needs. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet, Coughing or wheezing, Rapid or irregular heartbeat. Treatments: Medications to improve heart function and control symptoms, Lifestyle changes (e.g., reducing salt intake, exercising regularly), Surgery (e.g., implanting a pacemaker, heart transplant).

name: Hodgkin's Lymphoma
text: Hodgkin's lymphoma is a cancer of the lymphatic system, which is part of the body's immune system. Symptoms: Enlarged lymph nodes, Fever, Night sweats, Unexplained weight loss. Treatments: Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Stem cell transplant.

name: Hyperthyroidism
text: Hyperthyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone. Symptoms: Weight loss, Increased appetite, Nervousness or anxiety, Tremors, Sweating, Heat sensitivity, Fatigue, Muscle weakness, Difficulty sleeping. Treatments: Antithyroid medication, Radioactive iodine therapy, Beta blockers.

name: Hypothyroidism
text: Hypothyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone. Symptoms: Fatigue, Weight gain, Cold intolerance, Dry skin, Hair loss, Constipation, Depression, Muscle weakness, Joint pain. Treatments: Levothyroxine (thyroid hormone replacement therapy).

name: Infectious Mononucleosis
text: Infectious mononucleosis, also known as mono or glandular fever, is a viral infection that causes fever, sore throat, and swollen lymph nodes. Symptoms: Fatigue, Fever, Sore throat, Swollen lymph nodes, Headache, Muscle aches, Rash. Treatments: Rest, Pain relievers, Drinking fluids, Steroids (in severe cases).

name: Influenza
text: Influenza, commonly known as the flu, is a viral infection that affects the respiratory system. Symptoms: Fever, Cough, Sore throat, Runny or stuffy nose, Body aches, Headache, Fatigue. Treatments: Rest, Drinking fluids, Pain relievers, Antiviral medication (in some cases).

name: Intestinal obstruction
text: Intestinal obstruction occurs when the small or large intestine is partially or completely blocked, leading to abdominal pain, bloating, vomiting, and constipation. Symptoms: Abdominal pain and cramping, Bloating, Vomiting, Constipation. Treatments: Surgery to remove the obstruction, Medications to relieve symptoms, Intravenous fluids and electrolytes.

name: Ischemic heart disease
text: Ischemic heart disease is a condition where the heart muscle is not getting enough blood and oxygen due to a narrowing or blockage of the coronary arteries. Symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort, Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Nausea. Treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g. exercise, healthy diet), Medications to lower blood pressure and cholesterol, Angioplasty or coronary artery bypass surgery.

name: Leukemia
text: Leukemia is a cancer of the blood cells, where abnormal white blood cells are produced in the bone marrow and interfere with the normal function of red blood cells and platelets. Symptoms: Fatigue, Fever, Frequent infections, Bruising or bleeding easily. Treatments: Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Stem cell transplant.

name: Liver cancer
text: Liver cancer is a type of cancer that originates in the liver cells and can spread to other parts of the body. Symptoms: Abdominal pain and swelling, Weight loss, Loss of appetite, Jaundice. Treatments: Surgery to remove the cancer, Chemotherapy, Liver transplant.

name: Lung cancer
text: Lung cancer is a type of cancer that starts in the lungs and can spread to other parts of the body. It is often caused by smoking or exposure to harmful substances like radon or asbestos. Symptoms: Coughing up blood, Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Hoarseness. Treatments: Surgery to remove the cancer, Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy.

name: Mitral stenosis
text: Mitral stenosis is a narrowing of the heart's mitral valve, which separates the upper and lower chambers of the left side of the heart. This narrowing restricts blood flow from the left atrium to the left ventricle, which can lead to a variety of symptoms and complications. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Heart palpitations, Chest pain, Swelling in the legs or feet, Coughing up blood. Treatments: Medications to reduce fluid buildup, Surgical repair or replacement of the mitral valve, Lifestyle changes, such as maintaining a healthy weight and quitting smoking.

name: Mitral valve regurgitation
text: Mitral valve regurgitation is a condition in which the heart's mitral valve doesn't close tightly, allowing blood to flow backward into the heart's upper chamber. This can lead to a variety of symptoms and complications. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Heart palpitations, Swelling in the legs or feet, Coughing up blood. Treatments: Medications to control blood pressure and reduce fluid buildup, Surgical repair or replacement of the mitral valve, Lifestyle changes, such as maintaining a healthy weight and quitting smoking.

name: Myeloma
text: Multiple myeloma is a type of cancer that affects plasma cells, a type of white blood cell. The cancerous plasma cells can build up in the bone marrow and form tumors in bones throughout the body. Myeloma can cause a variety of symptoms and complications. Symptoms: Bone pain, Fatigue, Increased susceptibility to infections, Kidney damage, Nausea and vomiting, Unexplained weight loss. Treatments: Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Stem cell transplant, Medications to strengthen bones, Pain management.

name: Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma
text: Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma is a type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which is a part of the body's immune system. The cancerous cells can accumulate in the lymph nodes, bone marrow, and other organs, leading to a variety of symptoms and complications. Symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes, Fatigue, Night sweats, Fever, Unexplained weight loss, Chest pain or pressure. Treatments: Chemotherapy, Radiation therapy, Immunotherapy, Stem cell transplant, Targeted therapy.

name: Pancreatic Cancer
text: Pancreatic cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the cells of the pancreas. It can spread quickly and is often difficult to detect early. Pancreatic cancer is the fourth leading cause of cancer death in the United States. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Loss of appetite, Weight loss, Jaundice, Nausea, Vomiting, New-onset diabetes, Fatigue, Depression. Treatments: Surgery, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy.

name: Peptic ulcer disease
text: Peptic ulcer disease (PUD) is a condition where there is an erosion in the lining of the stomach or the first part of the small intestine. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Bloating, Nausea, Vomiting, Loss of appetite. Treatments: Antibiotics to eliminate H. pylori bacteria, Proton pump inhibitors to reduce stomach acid production, H2 blockers to reduce stomach acid production, Antacids to neutralize stomach acid.

name: Peripheral arterial disease
text: Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) is a condition where there is a narrowing of the arteries that supply blood to the legs and feet. Symptoms: Leg pain, Numbness or weakness in legs, Coldness in lower leg or foot, Sores on toes, feet or legs that won't heal, Change in color of legs. Treatments: Smoking cessation, Exercise and physical therapy, Medications to manage symptoms and prevent blood clots, Angioplasty or stenting to open up blocked arteries, Surgery to bypass blocked arteries.

name: Pulmonary fibrosis
text: Pulmonary fibrosis (PF) is a condition where there is scarring or thickening of the tissue in the lungs, making it difficult for oxygen to pass through. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Dry cough, Fatigue, Unexplained weight loss, Muscle and joint pain. Treatments: Medications to reduce inflammation, Oxygen therapy to increase oxygen levels, Pulmonary rehabilitation to improve lung function, Lung transplant in severe cases.

name: Renal failure
text: Renal failure is a condition where the kidneys are no longer able to filter waste products from the blood. Symptoms: Swelling in hands, feet, and ankles, Fatigue, Nausea, Decreased appetite, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Dialysis to filter blood, Kidney transplant, Medications to control underlying causes, Dietary changes to manage electrolyte and fluid levels.

name: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
text: A progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, leading to muscle weakness and eventual paralysis. Symptoms: Muscle weakness and stiffness, Difficulty speaking and swallowing, Muscle twitching and cramping, Gradual loss of mobility, Difficulty breathing. Treatments: Medications to manage symptoms, Physical therapy and occupational therapy, Assistive devices to help with mobility and communication.

name: Anemia
text: A condition in which the body lacks enough red blood cells or hemoglobin, leading to reduced oxygen supply to tissues and organs. Symptoms: Fatigue and weakness, Shortness of breath, Dizziness, Headache, Pale skin, Irregular heartbeat. Treatments: Supplements to increase iron or vitamin levels, Blood transfusions, Medications to stimulate red blood cell production.

name: Anxiety disorders
text: A group of mental health disorders characterized by excessive worry, fear, or nervousness that interferes with daily activities. Symptoms: Excessive worrying, Feeling restless or on edge, Irritability, Difficulty concentrating, Muscle tension, Sleep problems, Panic attacks. Treatments: Therapy to learn coping strategies, Medications to manage symptoms, Lifestyle changes to promote relaxation and stress management.

name: Autism spectrum disorder
text: A neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by social, communication, and behavioral challenges that can vary widely in severity. Symptoms: Difficulty with social interactions, Delayed or absent language development, Repetitive behaviors or routines, Narrow interests, Sensory sensitivities. Treatments: Behavioral therapy to teach social and communication skills, Medications to manage co-occurring conditions, Lifestyle changes to support overall health and well-being.

name: Autoimmune Disorders
text: Autoimmune disorders refer to a group of diseases in which the immune system attacks healthy cells in the body by mistake. Symptoms: Fatigue, Joint pain and swelling, Skin problems, Abdominal pain, Digestive problems, Fever, Swollen glands, Muscle pain. Treatments: Anti-inflammatory medications, Immunosuppressant drugs, Corticosteroids, Physical therapy, Surgery (in severe cases).

name: Bipolar Disorder
text: Bipolar disorder is a mental illness characterized by extreme mood swings, including episodes of mania and depression. Symptoms: Mood swings, Mania (extreme high), Depression (extreme low), Fatigue, Insomnia, Irritability, Difficulty concentrating, Impaired judgment, Risk-taking behavior. Treatments: Mood stabilizing medications, Antidepressants, Antipsychotic medications, Psychotherapy, Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) (in severe cases).

name: Blood Clotting Disorders
text: Blood clotting disorders refer to a group of conditions in which the blood clots too easily or doesn't clot enough, leading to an increased risk of bleeding or clotting. Symptoms: Abnormal bleeding, Bruising, Blood in urine or stool, Swelling, Pain, Redness, Warmth in the affected area. Treatments: Blood thinners, Anticoagulants, Platelet inhibitors, Iron supplements (in some cases).

name: Brain Tumors
text: Brain tumors refer to abnormal growths of cells in the brain that can be cancerous (malignant) or non-cancerous (benign). Symptoms: Headaches, Seizures, Nausea and vomiting, Memory problems, Changes in vision, hearing, or speech, Difficulty walking or balancing, Weakness or numbness on one side of the body. Treatments: Surgery, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy, Steroids, Anti-seizure medications.

name: Cerebral Palsy
text: Cerebral palsy is a group of disorders that affect movement and muscle tone or posture. It is caused by damage that occurs to the immature brain as it develops, most often before birth. Symptoms: Muscle stiffness, Muscle weakness, Lack of muscle coordination, Tremors, Difficulty with fine motor skills, Difficulty with gross motor skills, Difficulty with swallowing or speaking. Treatments: Physical therapy, Occupational therapy, Speech therapy, Medications for muscle spasticity or seizures, Surgery in some cases.

name: Chronic kidney disease
text: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) is a condition characterized by a gradual loss of kidney function over time. It can lead to kidney failure if left untreated. Symptoms: Fatigue, Weakness, Loss of appetite, Swelling in the legs, Difficulty sleeping, Changes in urination (e.g., frequency, color, or smell). Treatments: Medications to control blood pressure and cholesterol levels, Dietary changes to manage potassium, sodium, and protein intake, Dialysis or kidney transplant in severe cases.

name: Colorectal cancer
text: Colorectal cancer is a type of cancer that affects the colon and/or rectum. It often starts as a polyp, which can eventually become cancerous if left untreated. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Blood in the stool, Changes in bowel habits (e.g., diarrhea or constipation), Unintended weight loss, Fatigue. Treatments: Surgery to remove the cancerous tissue, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy.

name: Congenital heart defects
text: Congenital heart defects are abnormalities in the heart's structure that are present at birth. They can affect the heart's valves, chambers, or blood vessels. Symptoms: Blue or gray skin color, Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Swelling in the legs, abdomen, or areas around the eyes, Delayed growth and development (in infants and children). Treatments: Surgery to repair the heart defect, Medications to control symptoms, Heart transplant in severe cases.

name: Depression
text: Depression is a mood disorder that can affect a person's thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. It can lead to feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and loss of interest in daily activities. Symptoms: Persistent feelings of sadness, anxiety, or emptiness, Loss of interest in activities that were once enjoyable, Difficulty sleeping or oversleeping, Changes in appetite or weight, Fatigue, Difficulty concentrating or making decisions. Treatments: Antidepressant medications, Psychotherapy, Brain stimulation therapies (e.g., electroconvulsive therapy or transcranial magnetic stimulation).

name: Down Syndrome
text: Down Syndrome is a genetic disorder that causes developmental and intellectual delays, as well as physical characteristics such as low muscle tone, upward slanting eyes, and a flat nasal bridge. Symptoms: Intellectual disability, Delayed developmental milestones, Hypotonia (low muscle tone), Upward slanting eyes, Flat nasal bridge, Short stature, Heart defects. Treatments: Early intervention and special education, Speech and physical therapy, Treatment of associated health issues.

name: Eczema
text: Eczema is a chronic skin condition characterized by itchy, inflamed patches of skin. The cause of eczema is unknown, but it is thought to be related to an overactive immune system and a defective skin barrier. Symptoms: Itchy, red, and dry skin, Thickened, cracked, or scaly skin, Small bumps that may leak fluid, Sensitive skin, Discoloration of the skin. Treatments: Moisturizers and topical steroids, Avoiding triggers (such as certain fabrics, soaps, or foods), Antihistamines for itching, Immunosuppressants for severe cases.

name: Erectile dysfunction
text: Erectile dysfunction is the inability to get or maintain an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse. Symptoms: Difficulty getting an erection, Difficulty maintaining an erection, Reduced sexual desire. Treatments: Oral medications such as sildenafil (Viagra), tadalafil (Cialis), or vardenafil (Levitra), Injections into the penis, Penile implants.

name: Graves' disease
text: Graves' disease is an autoimmune disorder that causes hyperthyroidism, or overactive thyroid. Symptoms: Anxiety and irritability, Weight loss, Rapid or irregular heartbeat. Treatments: Anti-thyroid medication such as methimazole or propylthiouracil, Radioactive iodine therapy, Surgery to remove the thyroid gland.

name: Hashimoto's thyroiditis
text: Hashimoto's thyroiditis is an autoimmune disorder that causes hypothyroidism, or underactive thyroid. Symptoms: Fatigue and sluggishness, Weight gain, Depression. Treatments: Synthetic thyroid hormone replacement therapy, Lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet and exercise, Avoiding certain foods such as soy and high-fiber foods.

name: Hearing loss
text: Hearing loss is the partial or total inability to hear sounds. Symptoms: Difficulty hearing conversations, Muffling of speech and other sounds, Ringing in the ears. Treatments: Hearing aids, Cochlear implants, Assistive listening devices.

name: Hemophilia
text: Hemophilia is a genetic disorder that affects the body's ability to clot blood, leading to excessive bleeding and easy bruising. Symptoms: Excessive bleeding, Frequent nosebleeds, Blood in the urine or stool. Treatments: Replacement therapy with clotting factors, Desmopressin to increase the levels of clotting factors, Gene therapy.

name: High blood pressure (hypertension)
text: High blood pressure is a common condition in which the force of blood against your artery walls is consistently too high, which can eventually cause health problems, such as heart disease. Symptoms: Headaches, Shortness of breath, Nosebleeds, Flushed face, Dizziness, Chest pain, Visual changes. Treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g., healthy diet, regular exercise, stress management), Medications (e.g., ACE inhibitors, diuretics, beta blockers), Monitoring blood pressure regularly.

name: High cholesterol
text: High cholesterol is a condition in which you have too much cholesterol — a waxy, fat-like substance — in your blood. High cholesterol can increase your risk of heart disease and other health problems. Symptoms: None (usually asymptomatic), Yellowish patches around the eyes, Xanthomas (fatty deposits) on the elbows, knees, and tendons. Treatments: Lifestyle changes (e.g., healthy diet, regular exercise, quitting smoking), Medications (e.g., statins, bile acid sequestrants, niacin), Monitoring cholesterol levels regularly.

name: Huntington's disease
text: Huntington's disease is a genetic disorder that causes the progressive breakdown of nerve cells in the brain, which leads to mental and physical disabilities. Symptoms: Difficulty concentrating and remembering things, Depression and anxiety, Uncontrolled movements (chorea), Difficulty with coordination and balance, Difficulty with speech and swallowing. Treatments: Medications to control movement and psychiatric symptoms, Physical therapy to maintain mobility and prevent falls, Speech therapy to improve communication and swallowing.

name: Juvenile idiopathic arthritis
text: Juvenile idiopathic arthritis is a type of arthritis that affects children under the age of 16. It causes joint pain, swelling, stiffness, and reduced mobility. Symptoms: Joint pain and swelling, Stiffness, especially in the morning, Limping, High fever, Eye inflammation, Rash. Treatments: Medications to reduce inflammation and pain, Physical therapy to maintain joint mobility and strength, Occupational therapy to improve daily activities and quality of life.

name: Lou Gehrig's disease
text: Lou Gehrig's disease, also known as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), is a progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, leading to muscle weakness, paralysis, and eventually respiratory failure. Symptoms: Muscle weakness in hands, arms, legs or feet, Difficulty speaking, swallowing, or breathing, Muscle cramps and twitching. Treatments: Riluzole (Rilutek), Edaravone (Radicava), Physical therapy and occupational therapy, Breathing support.

name: Multiple myeloma
text: Multiple myeloma is a type of cancer that affects plasma cells, which are white blood cells that produce antibodies to help fight infections. In multiple myeloma, abnormal plasma cells accumulate in the bone marrow and can crowd out healthy blood cells. Symptoms: Bone pain, especially in the back or ribs, Weakness or fatigue, Frequent infections, Nausea or vomiting, Constipation. Treatments: Chemotherapy, Stem cell transplant, Radiation therapy, Targeted therapy, Immunotherapy.

name: Muscular dystrophy
text: Muscular dystrophy is a group of genetic disorders that cause progressive weakness and degeneration of the muscles. Different types of muscular dystrophy have different patterns of inheritance and affect different muscles in the body. Symptoms: Muscle weakness, Frequent falls, Difficulty walking, Muscle stiffness or rigidity, Difficulty breathing. Treatments: Physical therapy, Respiratory therapy, Orthopedic devices (e.g., braces, wheelchairs), Medications to improve muscle strength or delay progression of the disease.

name: Myasthenia gravis
text: Myasthenia gravis is a neuromuscular disorder that causes muscle weakness and fatigue. It occurs when the immune system attacks the receptors that allow nerve impulses to reach the muscles, leading to difficulty controlling the affected muscles. Symptoms: Weakness in the muscles that control eye movement, Double vision, Difficulty speaking or swallowing, Weakness in the arms, legs, or neck, Difficulty breathing. Treatments: Medications that suppress the immune system, Medications that improve nerve function or increase muscle strength, Plasmapheresis (a procedure that removes harmful antibodies from the blood), Thymectomy (surgical removal of the thymus gland, which plays a role in the immune system).

name: Narcolepsy
text: Narcolepsy is a neurological disorder that affects the sleep-wake cycle. It causes sudden and uncontrollable sleepiness during the day, as well as other symptoms such as cataplexy (loss of muscle control during strong emotions) and hallucinations during sleep or wakefulness. Symptoms: Excessive daytime sleepiness, Sudden loss of muscle control (cataplexy), Sleep paralysis (inability to move or speak when falling asleep or waking up), Hallucinations during sleep or wakefulness, Disrupted nighttime sleep. Treatments: Stimulant medications to promote wakefulness, Sodium oxybate (a medication that improves nighttime sleep and reduces daytime sleepiness), Antidepressants or other medications to control cataplexy or hallucinations, Lifestyle changes to improve sleep hygiene (e.g., avoiding caffeine and alcohol, establishing a regular sleep schedule).

name: Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD)
text: Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease is a condition in which excess fat is stored in the liver. It is not caused by alcohol abuse, and can range from simple fat accumulation to inflammation and cirrhosis. Symptoms: Fatigue, Pain or discomfort in the upper right abdomen, Swelling in the abdomen, Elevated liver enzymes, Insulin resistance and high blood sugar. Treatments: Lifestyle changes such as weight loss, exercise, and a healthy diet, Control of underlying conditions such as diabetes and high cholesterol, Medications such as vitamin E, pioglitazone, and ursodeoxycholic acid.

name: Obesity
text: Obesity is a medical condition in which excess body fat has accumulated to the extent that it may have an adverse effect on health. It is a chronic disease that can lead to many other health problems. Symptoms: Increased body weight, Difficulty moving, Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Joint pain, Sleep apnea, High blood pressure, Type 2 diabetes, Heart disease, Stroke. Treatments: Dietary changes, Increased physical activity, Behavioral therapy, Weight-loss medications, Bariatric surgery.

name: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)
text: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) is a mental disorder in which a person has uncontrollable, recurring thoughts (obsessions) and/or behaviors (compulsions) that he or she feels the urge to repeat over and over. Symptoms: Obsessions, Compulsions, Fear of contamination, Aggressive impulses, Symmetry and orderliness, Excessive doubt, Hoarding, Trichotillomania, Skin picking. Treatments: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), Exposure and response prevention (ERP), Medication (SSRIs).

name: Ovarian cancer
text: Ovarian cancer is a cancer that forms in the ovaries. It is the fifth most common cancer among women. Symptoms: Abdominal bloating, Pelvic pain, Difficulty eating or feeling full quickly, Urinary symptoms, Back pain, Fatigue, Indigestion, Menstrual irregularities. Treatments: Surgery, Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy.

name: Paget's disease of bone
text: Paget's disease of bone is a chronic disorder that typically results in enlarged and deformed bones. It can affect any bone in the body, but most commonly affects the pelvis, spine, skull, and legs. Symptoms: Bone pain, Joint pain, Headaches, Hearing loss, Numbness or tingling, Enlarged bones, Bone deformities. Treatments: Bisphosphonate medications, Calcitonin, Surgery.

name: Peripheral artery disease (PAD)
text: Peripheral artery disease (PAD) is a common circulatory problem in which narrowed arteries reduce blood flow to your limbs. Symptoms: Painful cramping in hip, thigh or calf muscles after certain activities, such as walking or climbing stairs, Leg numbness or weakness, Coldness in your lower leg or foot, especially when compared with the other side, Sores on your toes, feet or legs that won't heal, A change in the color of your legs, Hair loss or slower hair growth on your feet and legs, Slower growth of toenails, Shiny skin on your legs, No pulse or a weak pulse in your legs or feet, Erectile dysfunction, especially in men with diabetes. Treatments: Lifestyle changes such as regular exercise, smoking cessation, and healthy diet, Medications like blood thinners, cholesterol-lowering drugs, and medications to control blood pressure, Angioplasty and stenting, Bypass surgery, Amputation of the affected limb, in severe cases.

name: Peripheral neuropathy
text: Peripheral neuropathy is a condition that occurs when the nerves that carry information to and from the brain and spinal cord to the rest of the body are damaged or diseased. Symptoms: Tingling, burning or prickling sensations in the affected area, Sharp, stabbing or shooting pain, Extreme sensitivity to touch, Lack of coordination and falling, Muscle weakness or paralysis if motor nerves are affected, Partial or complete loss of sensation if sensory nerves are affected, Bowel or bladder dysfunction if autonomic nerves are affected, Changes in blood pressure and sweating. Treatments: Treatment of the underlying condition that caused the neuropathy, Medications to relieve pain, such as over-the-counter painkillers, anti-seizure drugs, and antidepressants, Topical treatments like capsaicin cream or lidocaine patches, Physical therapy to help maintain strength and balance, Occupational therapy to help with everyday activities, Surgery, in severe cases.

name: Peyronie's disease
text: Peyronie's disease is a condition in which fibrous scar tissue develops inside the penis, causing curved, painful erections. Symptoms: Bent penis during an erection, Erectile dysfunction, Pain during an erection, Shortening of the penis. Treatments: Medications like collagenase clostridium histolyticum to break down the scar tissue, Injections of verapamil or interferon to reduce the size of the plaque, Surgery, such as plication or grafting, to straighten the penis, Penile implants, in severe cases.

name: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)
text: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is a mental health condition triggered by a traumatic event such as combat, natural disasters, sexual assault or serious accidents. People with PTSD often experience flashbacks, nightmares, anxiety, and a feeling of detachment from the world. Symptoms: Flashbacks or reliving the traumatic event, Nightmares and sleep disturbances, Avoiding reminders of the traumatic event, Feeling numb or detached from the world, Hyperarousal or being easily startled, Negative changes in thinking or mood. Treatments: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), Eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR), Medications such as antidepressants or anti-anxiety drugs.

name: Primary biliary cirrhosis
text: Primary biliary cirrhosis (PBC) is a chronic liver disease in which the small bile ducts in the liver are gradually destroyed, leading to a buildup of bile and damage to liver cells. The cause of PBC is unknown, but it is thought to be an autoimmune disorder. Symptoms: Fatigue, Itching, Dry eyes and mouth, Enlarged liver or spleen, Jaundice, Osteoporosis. Treatments: Ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) to slow the progression of the disease, Vitamin and mineral supplements, Medications to relieve itching or other symptoms, Liver transplant in severe cases.

name: Primary sclerosing cholangitis
text: Primary sclerosing cholangitis is a chronic liver disease characterized by inflammation and scarring of the bile ducts. Over time, this can lead to liver damage and cirrhosis. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Fatigue, Itching, Jaundice, Weight loss. Treatments: Ursodeoxycholic acid, Endoscopic therapy, Liver transplantation.

name: Raynaud's disease
text: Raynaud's disease is a condition that affects the blood vessels in the fingers and toes, causing them to narrow and reduce blood flow. This can lead to numbness, tingling, and color changes in the affected areas. Symptoms: Numbness, Tingling, Color changes in fingers and toes, Cold fingers and toes. Treatments: Avoiding triggers such as cold temperatures and stress, Medications to improve blood flow, Biofeedback.

name: Restless legs syndrome (RLS)
text: Restless legs syndrome is a condition that causes an uncontrollable urge to move the legs, often accompanied by uncomfortable sensations in the legs such as tingling, itching, or crawling. Symptoms: Uncontrollable urge to move legs, Tingling or crawling sensations in legs, Difficulty sleeping. Treatments: Medications such as dopamine agonists and opioids, Lifestyle changes such as regular exercise and good sleep habits.

name: Scleroderma
text: Scleroderma is a group of rare autoimmune diseases that cause the skin and connective tissues to harden and thicken. In some cases, scleroderma can also affect the internal organs such as the lungs, heart, and kidneys. Symptoms: Thickening and hardening of skin, Digestive problems, Joint pain and stiffness, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Immunosuppressive medications, Medications to treat specific symptoms, Physical therapy.

name: Sickle cell disease
text: Sickle cell disease is a genetic blood disorder that causes red blood cells to become misshapen and break down more easily than normal, leading to anemia and other complications. Symptoms: Anemia, Episodes of pain, Jaundice, Swelling of hands and feet. Treatments: Pain medications, Hydroxyurea to reduce the frequency of painful episodes, Blood transfusions.

name: Sleep Apnea
text: Sleep apnea is a sleep disorder characterized by pauses in breathing or shallow breaths during sleep. The condition can lead to poor sleep quality and excessive daytime sleepiness. Symptoms: Loud snoring, Episodes of breathing cessation during sleep witnessed by another person, Gasping or choking during sleep, Excessive daytime sleepiness, Difficulty concentrating, Morning headaches, Irritability. Treatments: Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) therapy, Oral appliances, Surgery, Lifestyle changes (e.g. weight loss, quitting smoking, avoiding alcohol and sedatives).

name: AIDS
text: AIDS (Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome) is a disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), which attacks and weakens the immune system. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Swollen lymph nodes, Rapid weight loss, Frequent infections, Skin rashes, Night sweats, Chronic diarrhea, Persistent cough, Memory loss, Depression, Neurological disorders. Treatments: Antiretroviral therapy, Prophylaxis for opportunistic infections, Supportive care.

name: Anthrax
text: Anthrax is a serious bacterial infection caused by the spore-forming bacterium Bacillus anthracis, which can affect both humans and animals. Symptoms: Flu-like symptoms, Skin lesions, Swelling, Fever, Chest discomfort, Shortness of breath, Nausea and vomiting, Abdominal pain, Headache, Confusion. Treatments: Antibiotics, Antitoxins, Wound care.

name: Avian influenza
text: Avian influenza, also known as bird flu, is a highly contagious viral infection that primarily affects birds but can also infect humans. Symptoms: Fever, Cough, Sore throat, Muscle aches, Fatigue, Headache, Difficulty breathing, Pneumonia, Acute respiratory distress syndrome, Multi-organ failure. Treatments: Antiviral drugs, Supportive care, Vaccines (for birds).

name: Bacterial meningitis
text: Bacterial meningitis is a serious infection of the meninges, which are the protective membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Stiff neck, Nausea and vomiting, Sensitivity to light, Confusion, Seizures, Coma. Treatments: Antibiotics, Corticosteroids, Supportive care.

name: Botulism
text: Botulism is a rare but serious bacterial infection caused by the toxin produced by the bacterium Clostridium botulinum, which can lead to paralysis and even death. Symptoms: Double vision, Blurred vision, Drooping eyelids, Slurred speech, Difficulty swallowing, Dry mouth, Muscle weakness, Paralysis, Respiratory failure. Treatments: Antitoxin, Ventilation support, Intensive care.

name: Brucellosis
text: Brucellosis is a bacterial infection that spreads from animals to people, usually through unpasteurized dairy products or contact with bodily fluids from infected animals. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Loss of appetite, Joint pain, Muscle pain, Sweating, Headache. Treatments: Antibiotics, Rest, Pain relievers.

name: Campylobacteriosis
text: Campylobacteriosis is a bacterial infection that causes diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. It is usually contracted through contaminated food, particularly undercooked poultry. Symptoms: Diarrhea, Abdominal pain, Fever, Nausea, Vomiting. Treatments: Fluids, Antibiotics, Rest.

name: Candidiasis
text: Candidiasis is a fungal infection caused by the overgrowth of yeast. It can occur in various parts of the body, including the mouth, throat, genitals, and skin. Symptoms: Redness, Itching, Burning, Swelling, White patches on the tongue or inside the mouth, Pain during sex, Discharge. Treatments: Antifungal medication, Topical creams, Oral medication.

name: Chagas disease
text: Chagas disease is a parasitic infection caused by the protozoan Trypanosoma cruzi. It is primarily found in Latin America, where it is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected triatomine bugs. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Body aches, Swollen lymph nodes, Headache, Enlarged liver or spleen, Heart palpitations. Treatments: Antiparasitic medication, Symptomatic treatment.

name: Chickenpox
text: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection that causes an itchy rash and blisters. It is primarily spread through direct contact with an infected person or through airborne transmission. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Loss of appetite, Headache, Itchy rash, Blisters, Body aches. Treatments: Antiviral medication, Symptomatic treatment.

name: Chlamydia
text: A common sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Chlamydia trachomatis. Symptoms: Painful urination, Abnormal vaginal discharge, Pain during sex. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain relievers, Abstaining from sexual activity.

name: Cholera
text: An acute diarrheal illness caused by the bacterium Vibrio cholerae. Symptoms: Profuse watery diarrhea, Vomiting, Dehydration. Treatments: Rehydration therapy, Antibiotics, Zinc supplements.

name: Coccidioidomycosis
text: A fungal infection caused by inhaling spores of the Coccidioides fungus. Symptoms: Cough, Fever, Chest pain. Treatments: Antifungal medications, Rest, Pain relievers.

name: Common cold
text: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract. Symptoms: Runny nose, Sore throat, Cough. Treatments: Rest, Fluids, Over-the-counter medications for symptom relief.

name: Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease
text: A rare and fatal brain disorder caused by prions, abnormal proteins that damage brain cells. Symptoms: Rapidly progressive dementia, Muscle stiffness, Difficulty with coordination and movement. Treatments: There is no cure or treatment that can slow the progression of the disease.

name: Cryptococcosis
text: Cryptococcosis is a fungal infection caused by Cryptococcus neoformans or Cryptococcus gattii. It can affect the lungs, brain, and other parts of the body. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Nausea and vomiting, Stiff neck, Sensitivity to light, Confusion, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Antifungal medications, Amphotericin B, Flucytosine, Fluconazole.

name: Cryptosporidiosis
text: Cryptosporidiosis is a parasitic infection caused by the Cryptosporidium parasite. It can cause diarrhea, stomach cramps, nausea, and vomiting. Symptoms: Diarrhea, Stomach cramps, Nausea, Vomiting, Fever, Dehydration. Treatments: Antiparasitic medications, Nitazoxanide, Azithromycin, Rehydration therapy.

name: Cytomegalovirus infection
text: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) is a common virus that can infect people of all ages. Most people with CMV have no symptoms, but it can cause serious problems in people with weakened immune systems. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Sore throat, Swollen glands, Muscle aches, Loss of appetite, Jaundice, Pneumonia, Encephalitis. Treatments: Antiviral medications, Ganciclovir, Valganciclovir, Foscarnet.

name: Dengue fever
text: Dengue fever is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes. It can cause a high fever, severe headache, joint and muscle pain, and a rash. Symptoms: High fever, Severe headache, Joint and muscle pain, Nausea and vomiting, Rash, Pain behind the eyes, Fatigue. Treatments: Pain relievers, Fluid replacement therapy, Rest, Preventing dehydration.

name: Diphtheria
text: Diphtheria is a bacterial infection that can cause severe respiratory and cardiac problems. It is spread through contact with an infected person or object. Symptoms: Sore throat, Fever, Swollen glands in the neck, Weakness and fatigue, Difficulty breathing, Nasal discharge, Formation of a thick grayish coating in the throat and nose. Treatments: Antibiotics, Diphtheria antitoxin, Supportive care.

name: Ebola virus disease
text: Ebola virus disease (EVD) is a rare but severe illness caused by the Ebola virus. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle pain, Fatigue, Diarrhea, Vomiting, Abdominal pain, Unexplained hemorrhage. Treatments: Supportive care, Experimental treatments.

name: Ehrlichiosis
text: Ehrlichiosis is a bacterial illness transmitted by ticks that causes flu-like symptoms. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle aches, Fatigue, Nausea, Vomiting, Diarrhea, Cough, Joint pain, Confusion. Treatments: Doxycycline, Other antibiotics.

name: E. coli infection
text: E. coli infection is a type of foodborne illness caused by consuming food or water contaminated with the bacteria E. coli. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Nausea, Vomiting, Fatigue, Fever, Bloody stool. Treatments: Supportive care, Fluid replacement.

name: Encephalitis
text: Encephalitis is inflammation of the brain, usually caused by a viral infection. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Stiff neck, Confusion, Seizures, Muscle weakness, Personality changes, Loss of consciousness. Treatments: Antiviral medications, Steroids, Supportive care.

name: Enterovirus infection
text: Enterovirus infection is a viral illness that can cause a range of symptoms from mild to severe. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle aches, Fatigue, Rash, Sore throat, Runny nose, Cough, Diarrhea, Vomiting, Meningitis, Encephalitis. Treatments: Supportive care, Antiviral medications, Pain and fever relief.

name: Erysipelas
text: Erysipelas is a bacterial skin infection that usually affects the legs, but can also occur on the face, arms and other parts of the body. It is caused by group A streptococcus bacteria and is characterized by redness, warmth, and swelling of the affected area. Symptoms: Redness, warmth, and swelling of the skin, Fever, Chills, Fatigue, Pain and tenderness in the affected area, Blisters and sores may develop. Treatments: Antibiotics, such as penicillin or erythromycin, Pain relievers, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, Elevating the affected limb to reduce swelling, Resting and staying hydrated.

name: Escherichia coli O157:H7 infection
text: Escherichia coli O157:H7 is a strain of E. coli bacteria that can cause severe foodborne illness. It is typically spread through contaminated food or water and can lead to symptoms such as abdominal pain, diarrhea, and dehydration. In severe cases, it can cause kidney failure and other complications. Symptoms: Abdominal pain and cramping, Diarrhea, often bloody, Nausea and vomiting, Dehydration, Fever, Fatigue. Treatments: Drinking plenty of fluids to prevent dehydration, Antibiotics are not recommended for treating E. coli O157:H7 infection as they can increase the risk of kidney damage, In severe cases, hospitalization may be necessary.

name: Filariasis
text: Filariasis is a parasitic infection that is transmitted by mosquitoes. It can lead to a variety of symptoms, including fever, lymphedema, and elephantiasis. The infection is common in many tropical and subtropical regions of the world. Symptoms: Swelling of the limbs, genitalia, or breasts, Fever, Chills, Muscle and joint pain, Fatigue, Skin rash, Lymphedema. Treatments: Antiparasitic medication, such as diethylcarbamazine, Symptomatic treatment, such as pain relievers or antibiotics to treat secondary infections, Preventive measures, such as mosquito control measures and the use of bed nets.

name: Giardiasis
text: Giardiasis is a diarrheal illness caused by the microscopic parasite Giardia. Symptoms: diarrhea, abdominal cramps, bloating, nausea, fatigue, loss of appetite, weight loss. Treatments: Antibiotics, Anti-diarrheal medications, Rehydration therapy.

name: Gonorrhea
text: Gonorrhea is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Symptoms: painful urination, abnormal discharge, painful intercourse, lower abdominal pain, fever. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain relief medication, Rest, Safe sex practices.

name: Group A streptococcal infection
text: Group A streptococcal infection is a bacterial infection caused by group A streptococcus. Symptoms: fever, sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, rash. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain relief medication, Rest.

name: Haemophilus influenzae infection
text: Haemophilus influenzae infection is a bacterial infection caused by Haemophilus influenzae. Symptoms: fever, headache, stiff neck, fatigue, ear pain, difficulty breathing. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain relief medication, Rest.

name: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome
text: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome is a rare but serious respiratory disease caused by hantavirus. Symptoms: fever, muscle aches, fatigue, shortness of breath, cough, headaches, abdominal pain. Treatments: Hospitalization, Oxygen therapy, Fluid replacement therapy.

name: Helminthiasis
text: Helminthiasis is a parasitic disease caused by helminths. Symptoms: abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, fever, fatigue, weight loss. Treatments: Antiparasitic medications, Surgery (in some cases).

name: Hepatitis A
text: Hepatitis A is a highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus. Symptoms: Fatigue, Nausea and vomiting, Abdominal pain, Loss of appetite, Dark urine, Joint pain, Jaundice. Treatments: Rest, Adequate nutrition, Fluids, Vaccination.

name: Hepatitis B
text: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause both acute and chronic disease. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Loss of appetite, Nausea, Vomiting, Abdominal pain, Joint pain, Jaundice. Treatments: Antiviral medication, Rest, Adequate nutrition, Fluids, Vaccination.

name: Hepatitis C
text: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation, sometimes leading to serious liver damage. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Joint pain, Muscle pain, Loss of appetite, Nausea, Vomiting, Abdominal pain, Dark urine, Jaundice. Treatments: Antiviral medication, Rest, Adequate nutrition, Fluids.

name: Herpes zoster
text: Herpes zoster, also known as shingles, is a viral infection that causes a painful rash. Symptoms: Pain, burning, or tingling on one side of the body, A rash that appears as a band or stripe on one side of the body, Blisters that break open and crust over, Itching, Fever, Headache, Sensitivity to light. Treatments: Antiviral medication, Pain relievers, Topical creams or gels, Cool, wet compresses, Rest.

name: Histoplasmosis
