text: Histoplasmosis is a fungal infection caused by inhaling spores of the fungus Histoplasma capsulatum. It can cause flu-like symptoms and can be severe in people with weakened immune systems. Symptoms: Fever, Cough, Chest pain, Fatigue, Body aches. Treatments: Antifungal medications, Oxygen therapy, Intravenous fluids.

name: Hookworm infection
text: Hookworm infection is caused by parasitic worms that live in the intestines. It is commonly found in areas with poor sanitation and can lead to anemia and malnutrition. Symptoms: Itching and a rash at the site of infection, Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Fatigue, Loss of appetite. Treatments: Anthelmintic medications, Iron supplements, Intravenous fluids.

name: Human papillomavirus infection
text: Human papillomavirus (HPV) is a viral infection that can cause genital warts and increase the risk of developing certain cancers, including cervical cancer. Symptoms: Genital warts, Abnormal Pap test results, No symptoms in many cases. Treatments: Medications to treat warts, Surgery to remove abnormal tissue, Vaccines to prevent infection.

name: Impetigo
text: Impetigo is a highly contagious bacterial skin infection that causes sores and blisters. It is common in children and can spread easily through contact with the infected person. Symptoms: Red sores that quickly turn into blisters, Fluid-filled blisters that burst and develop honey-colored crusts, Itching. Treatments: Antibiotic ointments or creams, Oral antibiotics, Keeping the affected area clean and covered.

name: Influenza
text: Influenza, or the flu, is a viral infection that affects the respiratory system. It can cause fever, cough, body aches, and other symptoms, and can be serious in people with weakened immune systems or other health conditions. Symptoms: Fever, Cough, Sore throat, Runny or stuffy nose, Body aches, Headache, Fatigue. Treatments: Antiviral medications, Fever-reducing medications, Fluids and rest.

name: Japanese encephalitis
text: Japanese encephalitis is a viral infection that is transmitted by mosquitoes and can cause inflammation of the brain. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Vomiting, Seizures, Stiff neck, Muscle weakness, Confusion. Treatments: Supportive care, Antiviral medication, Preventive vaccination.

name: Kawasaki disease
text: Kawasaki disease is an illness that primarily affects children and can cause inflammation in the blood vessels throughout the body. Symptoms: Fever, Red eyes, Rash, Swollen lymph nodes, Swollen hands and feet, Strawberry tongue. Treatments: Intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG), Aspirin, Corticosteroids.

name: Legionellosis
text: Legionellosis is a type of pneumonia caused by the Legionella bacteria. Symptoms: Cough, Fever, Shortness of breath, Muscle aches, Headache, Nausea and vomiting. Treatments: Antibiotics, Supportive care.

name: Leishmaniasis
text: Leishmaniasis is a parasitic disease that is transmitted by the bite of infected sand flies. Symptoms: Skin sores, Fever, Weight loss, Enlarged spleen and liver. Treatments: Antiparasitic medication, Wound care.

name: Leprosy
text: Leprosy is a chronic bacterial infection that can damage the skin, nerves, and other organs. Symptoms: Skin lesions, Numbness or lack of sensation, Muscle weakness, Eye problems, Nosebleeds. Treatments: Multidrug therapy, Surgery for deformities, Rehabilitation.

name: Leptospirosis
text: Leptospirosis is an infection caused by bacteria of the Leptospira genus. It can cause a wide range of symptoms, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving multiple organs. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle aches, Vomiting, Jaundice, Red eyes, Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Rash, Chills. Treatments: Antibiotics, Supportive care.

name: Listeriosis
text: Listeriosis is a serious infection caused by eating food contaminated with the bacterium Listeria monocytogenes. It can cause a variety of symptoms, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving the brain and other organs. Symptoms: Fever, Muscle aches, Nausea, Diarrhea, Headache, Stiff neck, Confusion, Loss of balance, Convulsions. Treatments: Antibiotics, Supportive care.

name: Lyme disease
text: Lyme disease is an infection caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi. It is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected blacklegged ticks. The symptoms of Lyme disease can vary widely, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving the heart, joints, and nervous system. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Fatigue, Muscle aches, Joint pain, Swollen lymph nodes, Bull's-eye rash. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain relievers.

name: Malaria
text: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites that are transmitted to people through the bites of infected female Anopheles mosquitoes. It can cause fever, chills, and flu-like symptoms, and can be a serious health risk if not treated promptly. Symptoms: Fever, Chills, Headache, Sweats, Fatigue, Nausea and vomiting, Muscle pain, Joint pain, Anemia, Convulsions. Treatments: Antimalarial medications, Supportive care.

name: Measles
text: Measles is a highly contagious viral disease that can be serious or even fatal. It is spread through the air by coughing or sneezing. The symptoms of measles include fever, cough, runny nose, and a rash all over the body. Symptoms: Fever, Cough, Runny nose, Red, watery eyes, Rash, Small white spots with bluish-white centers inside the mouth, Body aches. Treatments: Symptom relief, Supportive care.

name: Meningococcal disease
text: Meningococcal disease is a bacterial infection that can cause meningitis and sepsis. It is caused by the bacterium Neisseria meningitidis and is spread through respiratory and throat secretions. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Stiff neck, Nausea and vomiting, Sensitivity to light, Confusion, Rash. Treatments: Antibiotics, Intravenous fluids, Oxygen therapy, Supportive care.

name: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infection
text: MRSA is a type of staph infection that is resistant to many antibiotics. It can cause skin infections, pneumonia, and other infections. MRSA is spread through contact with contaminated surfaces or through skin-to-skin contact. Symptoms: Redness and swelling of the skin, Painful skin lesions, Fever, Chills, Chest pain, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Antibiotics, Draining of abscesses, Supportive care.

name: Molluscum contagiosum
text: Molluscum contagiosum is a viral infection that causes small, raised, pearl-like bumps on the skin. It is spread through skin-to-skin contact and contact with contaminated objects. Symptoms: Small, raised bumps on the skin, White, waxy cores in the bumps, Itching. Treatments: Topical medications, Cryotherapy, Curettage, Laser therapy.

name: Monkeypox
text: Monkeypox is a rare viral disease that is similar to smallpox. It is spread through contact with infected animals or humans. Monkeypox can cause fever, rash, and pustules on the skin. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle aches, Backache, Swollen lymph nodes, Chills, Exhaustion, Rash. Treatments: Supportive care, Antiviral medications.

name: Mumps
text: Mumps is a viral infection that causes swelling of the salivary glands. It is spread through respiratory droplets and contact with contaminated surfaces. Mumps can also cause inflammation of the testicles, ovaries, and brain. Symptoms: Swelling of the salivary glands, Fever, Headache, Muscle aches, Fatigue, Loss of appetite, Painful testicles or breasts, Stiff neck, Difficulty swallowing. Treatments: Supportive care, Pain relievers, Ice packs, Fluids.

name: Mycobacterium avium complex infection
text: Mycobacterium avium complex (MAC) infection is a type of bacterial infection that commonly affects people with weakened immune systems, such as those with HIV/AIDS. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Weight loss, Night sweats, Diarrhea, Abdominal pain, Persistent cough, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Antibiotics, Antimicrobial therapy, Immune system therapy.

name: Mycoplasma pneumonia
text: Mycoplasma pneumonia is a type of bacterial pneumonia that affects the respiratory system. Symptoms: Fever, Cough, Sore throat, Headache, Fatigue, Muscle aches, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Antibiotics, Anti-inflammatory medications, Rest and fluids.

name: Necrotizing fasciitis
text: Necrotizing fasciitis is a rare but serious bacterial infection that affects the soft tissue under the skin, including muscle and fat. Symptoms: Intense pain, Swelling, Redness, Fever, Nausea and vomiting, Fatigue, Ulcers or blisters, Blackened or dead skin. Treatments: Antibiotics, Surgery to remove infected tissue, Supportive care.

name: Neonatal tetanus
text: Neonatal tetanus is a type of tetanus that affects newborn babies. It is caused by exposure to the bacteria that produce tetanus toxin. Symptoms: Stiffness and spasms in the muscles, Irritability, Difficulty feeding, Difficulty breathing, Fever, Sweating, High blood pressure, Rapid heart rate. Treatments: Antibiotics, Tetanus immunoglobulin, Supportive care.

name: Norovirus infection
text: Norovirus infection is a type of viral infection that affects the stomach and intestines. It is highly contagious and can spread easily in crowded places. Symptoms: Nausea, Vomiting, Diarrhea, Stomach cramps, Fever, Headache, Body aches. Treatments: Rest and fluids, Anti-nausea medication, Rehydration therapy.

name: Onchocerciasis
text: Onchocerciasis, also known as river blindness, is a parasitic disease caused by the worm Onchocerca volvulus. It is transmitted to humans through the bites of blackflies. Symptoms: Skin rash, Itching, Eye lesions, Visual impairment. Treatments: Ivermectin, Doxycycline, Surgery (for advanced cases).

name: Ophthalmia neonatorum
text: Ophthalmia neonatorum is a form of conjunctivitis that occurs in newborn babies. It is usually caused by an infection acquired during delivery from the mother, who may have a sexually transmitted infection. Symptoms: Eye redness, Swelling of the eyelids, Discharge from the eyes. Treatments: Antibiotic eye drops or ointment, Preventive measures (e.g. screening and treating pregnant women for STIs).

name: Osteomyelitis
text: Osteomyelitis is a bone infection that can occur in any bone in the body. It is usually caused by bacteria that enter the bone through a wound or during surgery. Symptoms: Pain and tenderness in the affected area, Swelling, Fever, Fatigue. Treatments: Antibiotics (oral or intravenous), Surgery (for severe cases or to remove dead tissue).

name: Paratyphoid fever
text: Paratyphoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella Paratyphi bacteria. It is usually contracted by consuming contaminated food or water. Symptoms: Fever, Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Nausea and vomiting. Treatments: Antibiotics, Fluid and electrolyte replacement, Rest and adequate nutrition.

name: Pertussis
text: Pertussis, also known as whooping cough, is a highly contagious respiratory infection caused by the bacterium Bordetella pertussis. It can affect people of all ages, but is most dangerous for infants. Symptoms: Cough (often severe and persistent), Whooping sound during coughing fits, Vomiting, Fatigue. Treatments: Antibiotics (to prevent the spread of the infection), Supportive care (e.g. fluids, rest, and nutrition), Vaccination (to prevent infection).

name: Pneumococcal disease
text: Pneumococcal disease is an infection caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae bacteria. It can lead to pneumonia, meningitis, and other infections. Symptoms: Fever, Cough, Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Stiff neck, Headache. Treatments: Antibiotics, Vaccination.

name: Poliomyelitis
text: Poliomyelitis, also known as polio, is a highly contagious viral infection that can lead to paralysis, breathing problems, and even death. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Nausea, Vomiting, Stiffness in the neck, Muscle weakness or paralysis. Treatments: Supportive care, Vaccination.

name: Q fever
text: Q fever is a bacterial infection caused by Coxiella burnetii. It can cause fever, headaches, muscle aches, and pneumonia. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle aches, Chills, Sweats, Cough, Chest pain. Treatments: Antibiotics, Supportive care.

name: Rabies
text: Rabies is a deadly viral infection that is transmitted to humans through the bite of an infected animal, such as a dog or bat. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle weakness, Seizures, Excessive salivation, Paralysis. Treatments: Post-exposure prophylaxis, Vaccination.

name: Respiratory syncytial virus infection
text: Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) infection is a common respiratory infection that can cause serious illness, particularly in young children and older adults. Symptoms: Runny or stuffy nose, Cough, Fever, Wheezing, Difficulty breathing. Treatments: Supportive care, Antiviral medication.

name: Rheumatic fever
text: Rheumatic fever is a complication of untreated strep throat. It can cause inflammation of the heart, joints, and other organs. Symptoms: Fever, Joint pain and swelling, Chest pain, Shortness of breath. Treatments: Antibiotics, Anti-inflammatory medication, Bed rest.

name: Rift Valley fever
text: Rift Valley fever is a viral disease that affects both humans and animals. It is most commonly found in sub-Saharan Africa. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle pain, Fatigue. Treatments: Symptomatic treatment, Fluid and electrolyte replacement, Supportive care.

name: Rocky Mountain spotted fever
text: Rocky Mountain spotted fever is a bacterial infection that is spread by ticks. It is most commonly found in North and South America. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle pain, Rash. Treatments: Antibiotics, Symptomatic treatment, Supportive care.

name: Rotavirus infection
text: Rotavirus infection is a common cause of diarrhea in infants and young children. It can lead to dehydration and other complications. Symptoms: Diarrhea, Vomiting, Fever, Abdominal pain. Treatments: Rehydration therapy, Symptomatic treatment, Prevention through vaccination.

name: Rubella
text: Rubella, also known as German measles, is a viral infection that can cause rash, fever, and swollen lymph nodes. Symptoms: Rash, Fever, Headache, Swollen lymph nodes. Treatments: Symptomatic treatment, Prevention through vaccination.

name: Salmonellosis
text: Salmonellosis is a bacterial infection that can cause diarrhea, fever, and abdominal cramps. Most people recover without treatment, but in some cases, it can lead to more severe illness. Symptoms: Nausea, Vomiting, Abdominal cramps, Fever, Diarrhea, Headache. Treatments: Drinking fluids to prevent dehydration, Antibiotics (in severe cases).

name: SARS (severe acute respiratory syndrome)
text: SARS is a serious respiratory illness caused by the SARS coronavirus. It first appeared in Asia in 2003 and spread to several other countries. SARS can cause severe breathing problems, fever, and other symptoms. Symptoms: Fever, Chills, Dry cough, Shortness of breath, Muscle aches, Headache, Sore throat, Malaise. Treatments: Antiviral medications (in some cases), Corticosteroids (to reduce inflammation), Oxygen therapy.

name: Scabies
text: Scabies is a contagious skin condition caused by tiny mites that burrow into the skin. It causes intense itching and a rash. Symptoms: Intense itching (especially at night), Rash (usually on the hands, feet, or genitals), Small, raised bumps on the skin. Treatments: Prescription medications to kill the mites, Topical creams or lotions.

name: Scarlet fever
text: Scarlet fever is a bacterial infection that can cause a bright red rash, fever, sore throat, and other symptoms. It is most common in children between the ages of 5 and 15. Symptoms: Fever, Sore throat, Bright red rash (usually on the chest, stomach, and limbs), Reddening of the tongue (known as "strawberry tongue"), Headache, Nausea, Vomiting. Treatments: Antibiotics, Over-the-counter pain relievers (to reduce fever and discomfort).

name: Shigellosis
text: Shigellosis is an infection caused by the Shigella bacteria. It can cause diarrhea, fever, and stomach cramps. In severe cases, it can lead to dehydration and other complications. Symptoms: Diarrhea (which may be bloody), Fever, Stomach cramps, Nausea, Vomiting. Treatments: Drinking fluids to prevent dehydration, Antibiotics (in severe cases).

name: Smallpox
text: Smallpox is a contagious disease caused by the variola virus. It is characterized by a fever and a distinctive rash. Symptoms: Fever, Fatigue, Headache, Backache, Rash. Treatments: Vaccination, Antiviral drugs, Symptomatic relief.

name: Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome
text: Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome is a rare skin condition caused by the bacteria Staphylococcus aureus. It is characterized by redness and blistering of the skin. Symptoms: Fever, Redness of the skin, Blisters on the skin, Skin peeling. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain relief medication, Intravenous fluids.

name: Strep throat
text: Strep throat is a bacterial infection that affects the throat and tonsils. It is characterized by a sore throat, fever, and swollen lymph nodes. Symptoms: Sore throat, Fever, Swollen lymph nodes, Difficulty swallowing. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain relief medication, Rest and fluids.

name: Syphilis
text: Syphilis is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacteria Treponema pallidum. It is characterized by a sore or ulcer at the site of infection and a rash that can appear on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet. Symptoms: Painless sore or ulcer, Rash on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet, Fever, Fatigue. Treatments: Antibiotics, Penicillin injections, Regular testing.

name: Tetanus
text: Tetanus is a bacterial infection that affects the nervous system. It is characterized by muscle stiffness and spasms, particularly in the jaw muscles. Symptoms: Muscle stiffness and spasms, Jaw cramping, Fever, Sweating. Treatments: Antitoxin medication, Muscle relaxants, Pain relief medication.

name: Toxoplasmosis
text: Toxoplasmosis is a parasitic infection caused by the Toxoplasma gondii parasite. It is usually transmitted through contact with contaminated cat feces, eating undercooked meat, or vertical transmission from mother to fetus during pregnancy. Symptoms: Flu-like symptoms (such as fever, fatigue, body aches), Swollen lymph nodes, Muscle aches and pains, Headache, Sore throat, Skin rash, Inflammation of the lungs, heart, or eyes (in severe cases). Treatments: Antibiotics (such as sulfadiazine, pyrimethamine, and clindamycin), Corticosteroids (to reduce inflammation in severe cases), Symptomatic treatment (such as pain relievers, fever reducers, and rest).

name: Trachoma
text: Trachoma is a bacterial infection of the eyes caused by the Chlamydia trachomatis bacterium. It is usually transmitted through contact with contaminated hands, clothing, or flies. Symptoms: Irritation and redness of the eyes, Swelling of the eyelids, Discharge from the eyes, Sensitivity to light, Blurred vision, Formation of small bumps on the inner surface of the eyelids (in severe cases). Treatments: Antibiotics (such as azithromycin and tetracycline), Surgery (in severe cases), Facial cleanliness and environmental improvements (to prevent transmission).

name: Tuberculosis
text: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection caused by the Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacterium. It usually affects the lungs, but can also affect other parts of the body. Symptoms: Coughing (with or without blood), Chest pain, Fatigue, Fever, Night sweats, Loss of appetite, Weight loss, Shortness of breath (in severe cases). Treatments: Antibiotics (such as isoniazid, rifampin, and ethambutol), Directly Observed Therapy (DOT) to ensure compliance with medication, Surgery (in severe cases), Vaccination (in some cases).

name: Tularemia
text: Tularemia is a rare infectious disease caused by the bacterium Francisella tularensis. Symptoms: Fever, Chills, Headache, Muscle aches, Joint pain, Dry cough, Progressive weakness. Treatments: Antibiotics, Supportive care.

name: Typhoid fever
text: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Abdominal pain, Loss of appetite, Fatigue, Diarrhea or constipation, Rash. Treatments: Antibiotics, Supportive care.

name: Typhus
text: Typhus is a group of infectious diseases caused by bacteria called Rickettsia. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Muscle pain, Nausea and vomiting, Rash, Cough. Treatments: Antibiotics, Supportive care.

name: Urinary tract infection (UTI)
text: Urinary tract infection (UTI) is an infection in any part of the urinary system, including the kidneys, bladder, and urethra. Symptoms: Burning sensation during urination, Frequent urge to urinate, Passing small amounts of urine, Cloudy urine, Strong-smelling urine, Pelvic pain. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain relievers.

name: Varicella (chickenpox)
text: Varicella, commonly known as chickenpox, is a highly contagious disease caused by the varicella-zoster virus. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Tiredness, Rash, Itching. Treatments: Antiviral medications, Calamine lotion, Acetaminophen (Tylenol) for fever and discomfort.

name: Vibrio infection
text: Vibrio infection is a bacterial infection caused by the Vibrio bacterium. Symptoms: Diarrhea, Abdominal pain, Nausea and vomiting, Fever, Chills, Low blood pressure. Treatments: Antibiotics, Supportive care.

name: West Nile virus infection
text: West Nile virus (WNV) is a viral infection that typically spreads through the bite of an infected mosquito. Most people with WNV do not experience any symptoms. However, about 1 in 5 people who are infected will develop a fever along with other symptoms. Symptoms: Fever, Headache, Body aches, Fatigue, Back pain, Skin rash, Swollen lymph nodes. Treatments: There is no specific treatment for WNV infection, Over-the-counter pain relievers can help reduce fever and relieve some symptoms, In severe cases, hospitalization may be necessary for supportive care, such as intravenous fluids, pain management, and nursing care.

name: Adenoiditis
text: Adenoiditis is an inflammation of the adenoids, which are small pads of tissue located in the back of the throat. Symptoms: Difficulty breathing through the nose, Snoring, Mouth breathing. Treatments: Antibiotics, Nasal decongestants, Surgery to remove the adenoids.

name: Anal fissure
text: An anal fissure is a tear in the lining of the anus, which can cause pain and bleeding during bowel movements. Symptoms: Pain during bowel movements, Bleeding from the anus, Itching or burning around the anus. Treatments: Stool softeners, Topical analgesics, Surgery in severe cases.

name: Bursitis
text: Bursitis is an inflammation of the bursae, which are small sacs of fluid that cushion the joints and reduce friction between bones and soft tissues. Symptoms: Joint pain, Swelling and redness, Stiffness and limited range of motion. Treatments: Rest and ice, Anti-inflammatory medication, Physical therapy.

name: Cholecystitis
text: Cholecystitis is an inflammation of the gallbladder, which is a small organ located near the liver that stores bile. Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Nausea and vomiting, Fever and chills. Treatments: Antibiotics, Pain medication, Surgery to remove the gallbladder in severe cases.

name: Chronic bronchitis
text: Chronic bronchitis is a type of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) that causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways in the lungs. Symptoms: Persistent cough, Shortness of breath, Chest tightness. Treatments: Bronchodilators, Corticosteroids, Oxygen therapy in severe cases.

name: Cirrhosis of the liver
text: Cirrhosis is a late stage of scarring of the liver caused by long-term liver damage. It can lead to liver failure and other complications such as bleeding, infections, and liver cancer. Symptoms: Fatigue, Weakness, Loss of appetite, Nausea and vomiting, Abdominal pain and swelling, Jaundice, Itchy skin, Easy bruising and bleeding, Spider-like blood vessels on the skin. Treatments: Medications to manage complications, Dietary changes to limit salt and fluid intake, Alcohol abstinence, Liver transplant.

name: Congestive heart failure
text: Congestive heart failure occurs when the heart is unable to pump enough blood to meet the body's needs. It can lead to symptoms such as shortness of breath, fatigue, and swelling in the legs and ankles. Symptoms: Shortness of breath, Fatigue, Swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet, Rapid or irregular heartbeat, Chest pain, Persistent cough or wheezing, Lack of appetite, Confusion or impaired thinking. Treatments: Medications to manage symptoms and improve heart function, Lifestyle changes such as diet and exercise, Implantation of devices such as pacemakers or defibrillators, Heart transplant.

name: Dental caries
text: Dental caries, also known as tooth decay, is a common dental problem caused by the breakdown of tooth enamel by bacteria. It can lead to pain, infection, and tooth loss if left untreated. Symptoms: Toothache or pain when eating or drinking, Sensitivity to hot or cold temperatures, Visible holes or pits in the teeth, Dark spots on the teeth, Bad breath or a bad taste in the mouth. Treatments: Fillings to repair cavities, Crowns to cover damaged teeth, Root canal therapy to treat infections, Tooth extraction in severe cases.

name: Heart Attack
text: A heart attack occurs when the blood flow to the heart muscle is blocked, usually by a blood clot. This can cause damage to the heart muscle and can be life-threatening. Symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort, Upper body pain or discomfort in the arms, back, neck, jaw, or stomach, Shortness of breath, Nausea or vomiting, Lightheadedness, dizziness, or fainting, Sweating. Treatments: Aspirin, Thrombolytics (clot-busting drugs), Antiplatelet drugs, Coronary angioplasty and stenting, Coronary artery bypass surgery.

name: Insomnia
text: Insomnia is a sleep disorder that makes it difficult to fall asleep or stay asleep. Symptoms: Difficulty falling asleep, Difficulty staying asleep, Waking up too early, Daytime fatigue, Difficulty concentrating. Treatments: Improving sleep habits, Medications, Cognitive behavioral therapy.

name: Intervertebral disc herniation
text: Intervertebral disc herniation is a condition in which the jelly-like center of a spinal disc pushes through a crack in the tough outer layer and puts pressure on the nerves near the spine. Symptoms: Back pain, Leg pain, Numbness or tingling in the legs or feet, Muscle weakness, Bowel or bladder problems. Treatments: Rest and activity modification, Physical therapy, Medications, Surgery.

name: Jaundice
text: Jaundice is a condition that causes yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes due to a buildup of bilirubin, a yellow pigment produced by the liver. Symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes, Dark urine, Pale stools, Fatigue, Abdominal pain. Treatments: Treating the underlying cause, Phototherapy, Exchange transfusion, Medications.

name: Nasal polyps
text: Nasal polyps are noncancerous growths that develop in the lining of the nose or sinuses. Symptoms: Stuffy or runny nose, Postnasal drip, Decreased sense of smell, Facial pain or pressure, Snoring. Treatments: Nasal corticosteroids, Nasal sprays, Antihistamines, Surgery.

name: Otitis media
text: Otitis media is an infection or inflammation of the middle ear, which is the space behind the eardrum that contains the small bones that vibrate in response to sound. Symptoms: Ear pain, Fever, Drainage from the ear, Difficulty hearing, Irritability. Treatments: Watchful waiting, Antibiotics, Pain relievers, Surgery.

name: Rectal cancer
text: Rectal cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the rectum, which is the last section of the large intestine. Symptoms: Bleeding from the rectum, Changes in bowel habits, Abdominal pain or discomfort, Weakness and fatigue, Unintended weight loss. Treatments: Surgery, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy.

name: Sciatica
text: Sciatica is a type of pain that affects the sciatic nerve, which runs from the lower back down to the legs and feet. Symptoms: Pain in the lower back, buttocks, and legs, Numbness or tingling in the legs or feet, Weakness in the legs, Difficulty walking. Treatments: Physical therapy, Pain medication, Steroid injections, Surgery.

name: Skin cancer
text: Skin cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the skin. Symptoms: Changes in the appearance of moles or other skin lesions, A new growth on the skin, A sore that doesn't heal, Pain, itching, or bleeding on the skin. Treatments: Surgery, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy.

name: Spinal stenosis
text: Spinal stenosis is a narrowing of the spaces within the spine, which can put pressure on the nerves that travel through the spine. Symptoms: Pain or numbness in the legs or arms, Weakness in the legs or arms, Difficulty walking or maintaining balance, Loss of bowel or bladder control. Treatments: Physical therapy, Pain medication, Steroid injections, Surgery.

name: Stomach cancer
text: Stomach cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the stomach. Symptoms: Abdominal pain or discomfort, Nausea or vomiting, Loss of appetite, Unintended weight loss, Feeling full after eating small amounts of food. Treatments: Surgery, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy, Targeted therapy.

name: Testicular cancer
text: Testicular cancer occurs when abnormal cells in the testicles grow and divide uncontrollably, forming a mass or tumor. Symptoms: A painless lump or swelling in the testicle, A feeling of heaviness in the scrotum, A dull ache in the abdomen or groin. Treatments: Surgery to remove the affected testicle (orchiectomy), Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy.

name: Thyroid cancer
text: Thyroid cancer is a type of cancer that starts in the cells of the thyroid gland, which is located in the front of the neck. Symptoms: A lump or swelling in the neck, Pain in the neck or throat, Difficulty swallowing or breathing. Treatments: Surgery to remove all or part of the thyroid gland, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy.

name: Tinnitus
text: Tinnitus is a condition where a person hears a ringing, buzzing, or other noise in one or both ears that is not caused by an external sound. Symptoms: Ringing, buzzing, or other noise in the ears, Difficulty sleeping or concentrating, Anxiety or depression. Treatments: Identifying and treating underlying causes (e.g., earwax buildup, high blood pressure), Using a white noise machine or other sound therapy, Counseling or therapy to help manage anxiety or depression.

name: Uterine cancer
text: Uterine cancer is a type of cancer that starts in the cells of the uterus (womb), which is a hollow organ in the female reproductive system. Symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding (e.g., bleeding between periods, after menopause), Pelvic pain or pressure, Pain during sex. Treatments: Surgery to remove the uterus (hysterectomy) and/or other affected organs, Radiation therapy, Chemotherapy.

name: Venous insufficiency
text: Venous insufficiency is a condition where the veins in the legs are unable to pump blood back up to the heart effectively, leading to swelling, pain, and other symptoms. Symptoms: Swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet, Pain, aching, or cramping in the legs, Skin changes (e.g., discoloration, thickening, ulcers). Treatments: Wearing compression stockings, Elevating the legs when sitting or lying down, Medications to improve blood flow or prevent blood clots.

name: Vertigo
text: Vertigo is a sensation of spinning dizziness that can occur without any movement. It is often caused by problems with the inner ear or brain. Symptoms: Dizziness, Balance problems, Nausea or vomiting, Headache, Sweating, Ringing in the ears. Treatments: Medications to relieve symptoms, Vestibular rehabilitation therapy, Surgery (in severe cases).

name: Vitiligo
text: Vitiligo is a condition that causes the skin to lose its pigment, resulting in white patches on the skin. It occurs when the cells that produce pigment in the skin are destroyed. Symptoms: White patches on the skin, Premature whitening of hair on scalp, eyelashes, eyebrows or beard, Loss of color inside the mouth, Loss or change in color of the retina. Treatments: Topical corticosteroids, Topical calcineurin inhibitors, Narrowband ultraviolet B (NB-UVB) therapy, Excimer laser, Depigmentation (in severe cases).

name: Whiplash
text: Whiplash is a neck injury that occurs when the head is suddenly jerked backward and then forward, causing damage to the soft tissues in the neck. Symptoms: Neck pain and stiffness, Headache, Shoulder pain, Dizziness, Fatigue, Difficulty concentrating. Treatments: Pain medication, Physical therapy, Chiropractic care, Muscle relaxants, Corticosteroid injections, Surgery (in rare cases).

name: Wilson's disease
text: Wilson's disease is a rare genetic disorder that causes copper to accumulate in the liver, brain and other organs. This can lead to liver disease, neurological problems and psychiatric symptoms. Symptoms: Fatigue, Abdominal pain, Jaundice, Tremors, Difficulty speaking or swallowing, Psychiatric symptoms (e.g. depression, anxiety, psychosis). Treatments: Chelation therapy, Zinc therapy, Liver transplant (in severe cases).

name: Yeast infection
text: A yeast infection is a common fungal infection caused by the overgrowth of the Candida fungus. Symptoms: Vaginal itching, Burning sensation during urination, Pain during sexual intercourse, Swelling and redness of the vulva, White, thick, odorless vaginal discharge with a cottage cheese-like appearance. Treatments: Antifungal creams, ointments, or suppositories, Antifungal oral medications, Boric acid suppositories, Probiotics.

name: Zika virus infection
text: Zika virus is a mosquito-borne virus that can cause mild to severe symptoms, including fever, rash, joint pain, and red eyes. It can also cause birth defects in infants born to infected mothers. Symptoms: Fever, Rash, Joint pain, Red eyes (conjunctivitis), Muscle pain, Headache. Treatments: Rest, Fluids, Pain relievers, Avoiding mosquito bites, Pregnant women should avoid travel to areas with ongoing Zika virus outbreaks.
